comment: So today is National Coming Out Day. It's been over years since I first came out to anyone, and it was the most nerve-racking thing I've ever done. I would rather present my Master's thesis presentation for continuous hours than re-live that moment. (Anyway, here I am in a Pride-colored Eagles tank top after a killer sunburn from a day out on Sebago.)
amr:
# ::snt So today is National Coming Out Day. It's been over years since I first came out to anyone, and it was the most nerve-racking thing I've ever done. I would rather present my Master's thesis presentation for continuous hours than re-live that moment. (Anyway, here I am in a Pride-colored Eagles tank top after a killer sunburn from a day out on Sebago.)
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (b / be-temporally-at-91
            :ARG1 (e / event
                  :name (n / name
                        :op1 "National"
                        :op2 "Coming"
                        :op3 "Out"
                        :op4 "Day"))
            :ARG2 (t / today))
      :snt2 (a / and
            :op1 (c / come-out-09
                  :ARG0 (ii / i)
                  :ord (o / ordinal-entity
                        :value 1)
                  :ARG2 (a2 / anyone))
            :op2 (t2 / thing
                  :ARG1-of (d / do-02
                        :ARG0 ii
                        :time (e2 / ever))
                  :ARG0-of (w / wrack-01
                        :ARG1 (n2 / nerve)
                        :ARG2-of (h / have-degree-91
                              :ARG1 t2
                              :ARG3 (m2 / most)))
                  :domain c))
      :snt3 (p / prefer-01
            :ARG0 (ii2 / i)
            :ARG1 (p2 / present-01
                  :ARG0 ii2
                  :ARG1 (p3 / presentation
                        :mod (t3 / thesis
                              :mod (m3 / master))
                        :poss ii2)
                  :duration (m4 / multiple
                        :op1 (t4 / temporal-quantity
                              :quant 1
                              :unit (h2 / hour))
                        :ARG1-of (c2 / continue-01)))
            :ARG2 (l / live-01
                  :ARG0 ii2
                  :ARG1 (m5 / moment
                        :mod (t5 / that))))
      :snt4 (w2 / wear-01
            :ARG0 (ii3 / i)
            :ARG1 (t6 / tank
                  :ARG1-of (c3 / color-01
                        :ARG2 (p4 / pride)))
            :time (a3 / after
                  :op1 (s / sunburn
                        :ARG0-of (k / kill-01)
                        :source (d2 / day
                              :location (c4 / city
                                    :name (n3 / name
                                          :op1 "Sebago")))))
            :mod (a4 / anyway)))

comment: Using hateful language doesn't contribute to your point
amr:
# ::snt Using hateful language doesn't contribute to your point
(c / contribute-01
      :polarity -
      :ARG0 (u / use-01
            :ARG0 (y / you)
            :ARG1 (l / language
                  :ARG0-of (h / hate-01)))
      :ARG2 (p / point-04
            :ARG0 y))

comment: When you use that kind of language it reflects poorly on your character.
amr:
# ::snt When you use that kind of language it reflects poorly on your character.
(r / reflect-01
      :ARG1 (u / use-01
            :ARG0 (y / you)
            :ARG1 (l / language
                  :mod (k / kind
                        :mod (t / that))))
      :ARG2 (c / character
            :poss y)
      :manner (p / poor)
      :condition u)

comment: There are millions of smart, caring, loving gays in the world. You should try to get to know one personally before attacking them.
amr:
# ::snt There are millions of smart, caring, loving gays in the world. You should try to get to know one personally before attacking them.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (p / person
            :ARG1-of (g / gay-01)
            :quant (m2 / multiple
                  :op1 1000000)
            :ARG1-of (s / smart-06)
            :ARG0-of (c / care-01)
            :ARG0-of (l / love-01)
            :location (w / world))
      :snt2 (r / recommend-01
            :ARG1 (t / try-01
                  :ARG0 (y / you)
                  :ARG1 (g2 / get-22
                        :ARG0 y
                        :ARG1 (k / know-02
                              :ARG0 y
                              :ARG1 (p2 / person))
                        :ARG1-of (p3 / personal-02))
                  :time (b / before
                        :op1 (a / attack-01
                              :ARG0 y
                              :ARG1 p2)))
            :ARG2 y))
